div1.p: Clemons thanks Kean for his recent letters and papers and states that they will be an important addition to the Walter Reed file. [Courtesy of The Albert and Shirley Small Special Collections Library, University of Virginia Library]

div1.head: Letter from Harry Clemons to Jefferson Randolph Kean, December 6, 1939
div1.p:
Your letter of November twenty-
eighth and the papers which were enclosed with it
form a valuable addition to the Walter Reed file in
the Alderman Library. Thanks to you, this has be-
come an important and significant collection, con-
taining essential information for future study of
the campaign against Yellow Fever.

I wish to express especially my appreciation
of your admirable review of the book on William Craw-
ford Gorgas. In 1924 I was in China and no details
reached me concerning the reception of that book, so
that your masterly article is quite new to me.

We have also received copies of the October
and November 1939 numbers of The Military Surgeon, in
the former of which we find your editorial on General
McCaw--a fine tribute to a distinguished Virginian and
a former Librarian of the great Army Medical Library.
For all of these we are very grateful.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, Harry Clemons Librarian
To General J. R. Kean
2804 N Street, N. W.
Washington, D. C.
